Peripheral.Name: Embedded Flash
Peripheral.Description: The Flash memory interface manages AXI accesses to the Flash memory. It implements the erase and program Flash memory operations and the read and write protection mechanisms

Peripheral.Name: OTP
Peripheral.Description: The Data OTP memory block. It contains the one time programmable bits.

Bit.Name: RDP
Bit.Description: Read protection option byte. The read protection is used to protect the software code stored in Flash memory.

Values.Val: or any value other than 0xAA and 0xCC: Level 1, read protection

Bit.Name: BOR_LEV
Bit.Description: These bits contain the supply level threshold that activates/releases the reset. They can be written to program a new BOR level value into Flash memory

Values.Val: reset level is set to 2.1 V
reset level is set to 2.4 V
reset level is set to 2.7 V
Independent watchdog is controlled by hardware
Independent watchdog is controlled by software
STOP mode on Domain 1 is entering with reset
STOP mode on Domain 1 is entering without reset
STANDBY mode on Domain 1 is entering with reset
STANDBY mode on Domain 1 is entering without reset
I/O speed optimization at low-voltage disabled
VDDMMC power rail operating below 2.5 V, I/O speed optimization at low-voltage feature allowed
Independent watchdog is freezed in STOP mode
Independent watchdog is running in STOP mode
Independent watchdog is freezed in STANDBY mode
Independent watchdog is running in STANDBY mode
Product working in the full voltage range,I/O speed optimization at low-voltage disabled
VDD I/O below 2.5 V,I/O speed optimization at low-voltage feature allowed
after boot loading, no swap for user sectors
after boot loading, user sectors swapped

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP1 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: PROT_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 PCROP End address (excluded). Deactivation of PCROP can be done by enbaling DMEP2 bit and changing RDP from level 1 to level 0 while putting end address greater than start address

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 PCROP zone is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END1
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 1 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START1, the whole bank 1 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START1, no protection is set on bank 1.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 1 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 1 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_START2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area start address

Bit.Name: SEC_AREA_END2
Bit.Description: Flash Bank 2 secure area end address. If this address is equal to SEC_AREA_START2, the whole bank 2 is secure protected.If this address is lower than SEC_AREA_START2, no protection is set on bank 2.

Values.Val: Flash Bank 2 secure area is kept when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs
Flash Bank 2 secure area is erased when RDP level regression (change from level 1 to 0) occurs

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD0
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=0

Bit.Name: BOOT_CM7_ADD1
Bit.Description: Define the boot address for Cortex-M7 when BOOT0=1
